1.text: Cut a larger piece of fabric for the bow and a smaller strip for the center.

2.text: Fold the bigger piece of fabric in half longways and crease it.

3.text: Unfold the fabric, then fold the top and bottom so they slightly overlap.

4.text: Fold the strip of fabric in half shortways, then iron the folds.

5.text: Fold the smaller piece of fabric in thirds longways, then iron it.

6.text: Unfold the large piece of fabric, then fold the ends in toward the center.

7.text: Accordion fold the fabric in the center 3 times.

8.text: Place a dot of hot glue in each of the creases of the accordion fold.

9.text: Glue one end of the smaller strip to the center of the bow.

10.text: Cut one long strip of grosgrain ribbon and one shorter piece.

11.text: Seal the ends of your ribbon with a lighter to prevent fraying.

12.text: Put a vertical line of hot glue in the center of the long ribbon.

13.text: Fold the left and right edges in and press them into the glue.

14.text: Create 3 accordion folds in the center of the bow.

15.text: Place a drop of glue inside each of the accordion folds.

16.text: Glue the small strip of ribbon around the center of the bow.

17.text: Cut a strip of fabric 3x longer than the size bow you want.

18.text: Fold the top and bottom edges down to the middle and glue them.

19.text: Make a vertical fold in the middle of the fabric, then pin the new center.

20.text: Open the folds in the fabric without removing the pin.

21.text: Tie a piece of string around the center of the bow to secure it.

22.text: Glue a small strip of fabric around the center of the bow.
